elements.title: You're a Computer Athlete (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

You're a Computer Athlete

You're likely a professional computer user â€“ you should behave like the athlete that you are

elements.title: Using Tana's Supertags with Search (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

elements.title: Learn how to use Supertags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

elements.title: Using Tana's Live Search Feature (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

elements.title: Get oriented in Tana's UI (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

elements.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

elements.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

elements.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

elements.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

elements.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

elements.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive â€“ you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

elements.title: The Grazing â€“ Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing â€“ Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

elements.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

elements.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

elements.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

elements.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

elements.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them â€“ and possibly what to do instead.

elements.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true â€“ sometimes you need to context switch.

elements.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable â€“ but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

elements.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

elements.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

elements.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

elements.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

elements.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

elements.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the âˆ† feature in Roam.

elements.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

elements.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

elements.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

elements.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

elements.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

elements.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

elements.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

elements.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

elements.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

elements.title: Crop switching can enhance environmental sustainability and farmer incomes in China (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Crop switching can enhance environmental sustainability and farmer incomes in China

Spatial optimizations of high-resolution data from China on crop-specific yields, harvested areas, environmental footprints and farmer incomes shows that crop switching can enhance environmental sustainability and farmer incomes, and contribute substantially towards Chinaâ€™s agricultural sustainable development targets.

  • Wei Xie
  • Anfeng Zhu
  • Kyle Frankel Davis
Article 16 Mar 2023

elements.title: Control of stereogenic oxygen in a helically chiral oxonium ion (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Control of stereogenic oxygen in a helically chiral oxonium ion

The design, synthesis and characterization of a helically chiral triaryloxonium ion is reported, which is an example of a chiral non-racemic and configurationally stable molecule in which the oxygen atom is the sole stereogenic centre.

  • Owen Smith
  • Mihai V. Popescu
  • Martin D. Smith

elements.contents:
Structural basis of odorant recognition by a human odorant receptor

Through the use of cryo-electron microscopy and molecular dynamics stimulations, mechanistic insight into the binding of an odorant to the human odorant receptor OR51E2 is provided.

  • Claire A. de March
  • Aashish Manglik
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: The menin inhibitor revumenib in KMT2A-rearranged or NPM1-mutant leukaemia (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The menin inhibitor revumenib in KMT2A-rearranged or NPM1-mutant leukaemia

Revumenib, a potent and selective oral inhibitor of the meninâ€“KMT2A interaction, is associated with a low frequency of treatment-related adverse events and promising clinical activity in patients with relapsed or refractory acute leukaemia.

  • Ghayas C. Issa
  • Ibrahim Aldoss
  • Eytan M. Stein
Article Open Access 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: In situ structure of the red algal phycobilisomeâ€“PSIIâ€“PSIâ€“LHC megacomplex (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
In situ structure of the red algal phycobilisomeâ€“PSIIâ€“PSIâ€“LHC megacomplex

In situ structures of PBSâ€“PSIIâ€“PSIâ€“LHC megacomplexes from the alga P. purpureum at near-atomic resolution using cryogenic-electron tomography and in situ single-particle analysis are reported, providing interaction details between PBS, PSII and PSI.

  • Xin You
  • Xing Zhang
  • Sen-Fang Sui
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Gate-tunable heavy fermions in a moirÃ© Kondo lattice (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Gate-tunable heavy fermions in a moirÃ© Kondo lattice

A Kondo lattice was realized in AB-stacked MoTe2/WSe2 moirÃ© bilayers and widely and continuously gate-tunable Kondo temperatures were demonstrated.

  • Jie Shan
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.contents:
A swapped genetic code prevents viral infections and gene transfer

A study details the creation of an Escherichia coli genetically recoded organism that is resistant to viral infection, and describes a further modification that keeps the organism and its genetic information biocontained.

  • Akos Nyerges
  • Svenja Vinke
  • George M. Church
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Whole-genome doubling drives oncogenic loss of chromatin segregation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Whole-genome doubling drives oncogenic loss of chromatin segregation

Whole-genome doubling induces the loss of segregation of chromatin compartments, and can lead to tumour-promoting epigenetic and transcriptional modifications.

  • Ruxandra A. Lambuta
  • Luca Nanni
  • Elisa Oricchio
Article Open Access 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Generation of functional oocytes from male mice in vitro (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Generation of functional oocytes from male mice in vitro

Mouse induced pluripotent stem cells derived from differentiated fibroblasts could be converted from male (XY) to female (XX), resulting in cells that could form oocytes and give rise to offspring after fertilization.

  • Kenta Murakami
  • Nobuhiko Hamazaki
  • Katsuhiko Hayashi
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Photonically active bowtie nanoassemblies with chirality continuum (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Photonically active bowtie nanoassemblies with chirality continuum

Self-limited assembly of 'imperfect' chiral nanoparticles enables formation of bowtie-shaped microparticles with size monodispersity and continuously variable chirality to be used for printing photonically active metasurfaces.

  • Prashant Kumar
  • Thi Vo
  • Nicholas A. Kotov
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: The dietary sweetener sucralose is a negative modulator of T cell-mediated responses (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The dietary sweetener sucralose is a negative modulator of T cell-mediated responses

Consumption of high doses of the sweetener sucralose has immunomodulatory effects in mice, as a result of reduced T cell proliferation and differentiation.

  • Fabio Zani
  • Julianna Blagih
  • Karen H. Vousden
Article Open Access 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Degassing of early-formed planetesimals restricted water delivery to Earth (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Degassing of early-formed planetesimals restricted water delivery to Earth

The very low water contents of minerals in achondrite meteorites from the early Solar System show that substantial amounts of water could only have been delivered to Earth by means of unmelted material.

  • M. E. Newcombe
  • S. G. Nielsen
  • A. J. Irving
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Bright and stable perovskite light-emitting diodes in the near-infrared range (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Bright and stable perovskite light-emitting diodes in the near-infrared range

Perovskite LEDs with exceptional performance at high brightness are demonstrated achieving an operational half-lifetime of 32â€‰hours, an important step towards commercialization opening up new opportunities beyond conventional LED technologies, such as perovskite electrically pumped lasers.

  • Yuqi Sun
  • Lishuang Ge
  • Neil C. Greenham
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Ultrafast tunable lasers using lithium niobate integrated photonics (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Ultrafast tunable lasers using lithium niobate integrated photonics

A frequency-tunable laser based on a hybrid silicon nitride and lithium niobate integrated photonic platform has a fast tuning rate and could be used for optical ranging applications.

  • Viacheslav Snigirev
  • Annina Riedhauser
  • Tobias J. Kippenberg
Article Open Access 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: The carbon sink of secondary and degraded humid tropical forests (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The carbon sink of secondary and degraded humid tropical forests

Analysis of satellite-based data on recovering degraded and secondary forests in three tropical moist forest regions quantifies the amount of aboveground carbon accumulated, which counterbalanced one quarter of carbon emissions from old-growth forest loss between 1984 and 2018.

  • Viola H. A. Heinrich
  • Christelle Vancutsem
  • Luiz E. O. C. AragÃ£o
Article 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Spatial epigenomeâ€“transcriptome co-profiling of mammalian tissues (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Spatial epigenomeâ€“transcriptome co-profiling of mammalian tissues

The authors present two technologies for spatially resolved, genome-wide, joint profiling of the epigenome and transcriptome by cosequencing chromatin accessibility and gene expression, or histone modifications and gene expression on the same tissue section at near-single-cell resolution.

  • Di Zhang
  • Yanxiang Deng
  • Rong Fan
Article Open Access 15 Mar 2023

elements.title: Regime shift in Arctic Ocean sea ice thickness (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Regime shift in Arctic Ocean sea ice thickness

A simple model describes the stochastic process of dynamic sea ice thickening, shows how reduced residence time affects changes in ice thickness and highlights the enduring impact of climate change on the Arctic Ocean.

  • Hiroshi Sumata
  • Laura de Steur
  • Sebastian Gerland
Article Open Access 15 Mar 2023
